question: Question_04_(b)
statement:
Consider the Fourier series

\begin{align*}t^2 - t = \sum_{n = -\infty}^\infty c_ne^{2\pi int}\end{align*}

for $0 \leq t \leq 1$.

\textbf{(b)} The coefficient \emph{c\textsubscript{n}} can be written as
an inner product $c_n = \langle f,g \rangle$. What are \emph{$f$} and
\emph{g}?
